summary: Highest-priority non-negotiable operating rules for all AI agents in this repo. Supersedes other assistant guidance unless explicitly overridden.
Repo operating manual for AI agents (determinism, RLS-first, no service_role in user flows, vertical slices, auditability, execution standards).
Repo primer for HPS DealEngine: what it is, how it works, how to operate safely (deterministic engine, Supabase/RLS model, UI↔engine contract).
Authoritative product roadmap across V1/V2/V3 themes and slices; governs sequencing, scope boundaries, and completion criteria.
Changelog/devlog of shipped work, decisions, pivots, and closeouts; used to keep historical truth and planning alignment.
QA/E2E harness instructions: local Supabase reset/start, seeding, env loading (.env.qa), preflight checks, and Playwright run posture.
System-prompt rules for DealEngine AI assistants covering identity, allowed/forbidden behavior, source hierarchy, and audit posture.
Captures CEO-level assumptions baked into docs, clarifying when to treat guidance as authoritative vs subject to override.
Defines source hierarchy for AI, from policy/math and engine outputs to product/playbooks and external market data, with usage rules.
Frontmatter schema used across docs so AI and humans can route by category, audience, and trust tier.
Entry point and sitemap for DealEngine docs with priority rules and boot sequence for AI assistants and humans.
Canonical prompt/response patterns for DealEngine AI (deal explain, run diff, seller questions, risk gaps, IC prep, evidence gaps).
Describes the current /dashboard layout, regions, and KPIs/cards with links to trace and domain sources.
Workflow for the Repairs tab from QuickEstimate through Big 5 and line items, including evidence expectations and integration with underwriting.
Intended map of primary routes, personas, and guards across Dashboard, Underwrite, Repairs, Trace, Sandbox, Deals, Runs, and Settings.
Step-by-step recipe for using /underwrite, running analyze, interpreting outputs, and reaching ReadyForOffer.
Canonical list of Dashboard KPIs with formulas, sources, dependencies, and placement; aligns UI with engine outputs and trace.
Narrative guide to what each Dashboard KPI means, how to act on it, and how to explain states with trace references.
Defines Market Temp from DOM/MOI inputs, speed bands, and how market speed influences carry, margins, and exit strategy.
Authoritative repairs policy covering Quick Estimate PSF, Big 5, line-item scopes, repair profiles, and contingency rules.
Intended source of truth for risk/compliance gates (flood, insurance, title, condo/SIRS, FHA/VA, PACE/UCC, FIRPTA/SCRA) and how they map to trace and UI.
Defines Days-to-Money, urgency bands, carry cost policy, and how timeline risks influence exits, strategy, and evidence.
Authoritative wholesale underwriting manual covering valuation standards, spreads, floors/ceilings, MAO selection, exits, and checklists.
Human-readable spec for AnalyzeInput/AnalyzeOutput and trace envelopes used by v1-analyze and runs-save.
Maps the Next.js app, Supabase Edge Functions, engine package, RLS model, and deterministic underwriting flow UI → Edge → DB.
Intended map of sandbox/policy knobs to engine behaviors and UI surfaces; currently a placeholder pointing to knobs audit.
Defines trace frame structure and semantics so UI/AI can explain underwriting decisions without re-deriving math.
Six end-to-end deal scenarios illustrating how spreads, risk gates, timeline, evidence, and strategy interact across the app.
Maps UI labels/components to glossary keys and source docs to keep terminology consistent across routes.
Canonical definitions for DealEngine terms (Respect Floor, Buyer Ceiling, DTM, Market Temp, Risk Gates, etc.) aligned with UI and engine.
Validation and integrity guidance across DB, engine, and UI plus SOPs for fixing bad data without breaking determinism or RLS.
Error taxonomy and support runbooks for auth, edge functions, RLS, evidence uploads, and outage/degraded states.
Reusable negotiation templates grounded in DealEngine guardrails, KPIs, risk gates, and evidence expectations.
Operational FAQ mapped to routes, KPIs, risk gates, and evidence so support and AI can answer consistently.
Maps the full lead-to-close lifecycle to DealEngine routes, data models, edge functions, and statuses.
Defines primary personas, jobs-to-be-done, workflows, and expectations that guide DealEngine product and AI behavior.
Defines HPS DealEngine's product vision, positioning, scope boundaries, and differentiation for investor/wholesaler operators.
